bibl.title: The Enigmatic Knidion: A Wine Measure in Late Roman / Byzantine Egypt?
bibl.note: The knidion served as a measure for wine, a measure dictated by the capacity of the knidion jar, namely four sectarii, the equivalent in modern terms of c. 2,2 liters.
